page.title: 01Summary of the Area
page.content: Most of our area is in {Staffordshire} but a small part is in {Derbyshire}.The River Dove forms the boundary between the two counties. There are two communities,{Mayfield in the South and Stanton in the West.} The land slopes from the River Dove at 100 m above sea level in the South to about 300m above sea level in the North. Mayfield's community grew in the Industrial Revolution because of the local mill. Stanton's population probabally grew as a result of the mining there, which now no longer takes place.{The largest part of the area is farmland.} There are thirteen farms altogether, mainly dairy farms with sheep too. There are plenty of woods and streams in our territory and the scenery is lovely.Not many tourists come however, they go to the popular area of {Dovedale} and to {Alton Towers} which are close by.
